fields.description:
h3. Summary
The dialog in JIRA that detects if the user's timezone is different to to server's timezone does not display internationalised messages. Instead it shows the dialog, but with the internationalisation keys only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Change the computer timezone and reload a page in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
A dialog with correctly internationalised text will appear.

h3. Actual Results
A dialog with the text key will appear

h3. Workaround
The dialog is still usable, however there is no way to get the correct translation string to appear.
fields.summary: JIRA timezone change dialog does not have internationalisation strings

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 26nd September 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi everyone,

This is not a JIRA issue. This is a confirmed issue by Jetbrains and is tracked as https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-157507.
Please watch the issue for the updates, I'm resolving the current issue as 'Not a Bug'.

Cheers,
Ignat
JIRA Bugmaster
 
{panel}  
h3. Summary

Several recent cases of users using IntelliJ connection with JIRA that are being logged out from a browser session.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install IntelliJ
 # Connect to JIRA:
 ** Clicking 'Command+,' (Mac only)
 ** Tools >> Tasks >> Servers
 ** Filling out Server URL, Username and Password
 ** Clearing Search
 # Keep a browser session to JIRA with same user
 # Keep doing operations in IntelliJ to JIRA, like seeing and transitioning tickets from IntelliJ:
 ** Top menu >> Tools >> Tasks & Contexts >> + Open task...
 ** Search for issue key, select it
 ** Top menu >> Tools >> Tasks & Contexts >> Close active task...

h3. Expected Results

The IntelliJ connection won't affect JIRA.
h3. Actual Results

The browser session is logs after some time.
h3. Workaround

Undoing the connection should resolve the problem (though IntelliJ won't be able to fetch issues/transition/etc. from JIRA anymore)
fields.summary: Integration with IntelliJ is causing browser session to log out

fields.description:
h3. Environment
iPhone (Safari) - possibly also Android and other mobile web)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Open WAC on Safari. 
2. Purchase a trial account of JIRA
3. Verify email address (web/mobile)
4. Log in after the instance has been activated. 

h3. Expected Results

No error message.

h3. Actual Results
!image1 (1).PNG|thumbnail! 

Ugly error message.
fields.summary: First use bug for new users that purchased JIRA from their iPhone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The operator 'changed' is not supporting fields in JIRA Cloud JQL (For example: 'status', 'assignee' fields)
h3. How to replicate
 # Go to JIRA
 # Go to JIRA Issue Navigator
 # Click on *Advanced* search
 # Paste this {{status changed DURING (-1, now())}}

h3. Actual Result

This error message will appear {{The operator 'changed' is not supported by the '...' field.}}
h3. Expected Result

It will show you some result.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround available for this moment
fields.summary: The operator 'changed' and 'was' are not supporting fields in JIRA Cloud JQL

fields.description:
h3. Update (25/1/16)

This issue was introduced as the result of a configuration change that affected our CDN. The configuration change has been reset to the previous value and will be applied to all instances during this week's maintenance window. If you are still seeing an error after the maintenance please contact support and quote this ticket.

h3. Summary

Issue Collectors failed to load the required resources from JIRA. The result is that the waiting spinner is never dismissed and the issue collector cannot be used.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Please create a support ticket [here|https://support.atlassian.com/] and reference this bug ticket to have us apply the workaround.
fields.summary: Issue Collector is unable to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changes made to the default field configuration after following the *Where is my field?* Navigation Link do not apply until JIRA is restarted.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-014
* Chrome, Firefox, safari, & IE

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Select Create issue
# Select *Where is my field?*
# Select a field that is missing from the create screen
# When Receiving the dialogue (EXE: Affects Version set to hidden in default field configuration):
{quote}
The field 'Affects Version/s' is hidden by the *Field Configuration 'Default Field Configuration'* that is configured for this issue.
To solve this problem, go to *that configuration* and click show to display the field 'Affects Version/s'.
{quote}
# Select the HyperLink for either
## *Field Configuration 'Default Field Configuration'*
## *that configuration*
# You are redirected to:
## {{https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ConfigureFieldLayout!default.jspa?id=10000}}
# Make any change at this location

h3. Expected Results
Changes are applied to Field Configuration

h3. Actual Results
Changes to the Field Configuration are persisted but the cache is not refreshed, so the changes do not take effect until a restart.

h3.Workaround
Instead, make changes to the default field configuration settings from the administration menu:
- Administration *COG* >> Issues >> Field Configuration >> Default Field Configuration
fields.summary: Cannot edit Default Field Configuration from the 'Where is my field?' link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The shortcut for an ordered list, Ctrl + Shift + N, opens a new incognito window in Chrome. This is for any WYSIWYG editor, but I'm specifically using the description editor on a new sub-task.

h3. Environment

Version: JIRA v7.1.0-OD-01
Chrome: Version 48.0.2564.97 (64-bit)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open WYSIWYG editor in JIRA
# Press Ctrl + Shift + N

h3. Expected Results

Ordered list should be presented

h3. Actual Results

A new incognito window opens in Chrome

h3.Workaround

Use the ordered list toolbar item
fields.summary: The shortcut for an ordered list, Ctrl + Shift + N, opens a new incognito window in Chrome.
Dashboard gadgets not loading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue collector can't be created due to an error: 
When opening the form, a popup error appears:
{code}Oops! Something went wrong...
There was a problem submitting your feedback, likely due to the configuration of this form. You might want to contact the site owner to let them know about this issue.{code}

And

{code}When submitting an Issue and if Attach file field are included, the error message on top of the field will show the following error:
Cannot attach file *filename*. You do not have permission to attach a file to the issue.{code}
 
In the issue Issue Collector Errors:
{code}
[13/12/2016 11:17:10] Unknown error occurred trying to invoke collector *Issue Collector Name* from *IP Address* by *Reporter*
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a project.
 # Create an Issue Collector
 # Embed the script into HTML file

Note: Issue happens to certain browser with random broken cookies
h3. Expected Result
Able to submit form

h3. Current Result
Error pops-up with the error:
!Selection_079.jpg|thumbnail!  
!Selection_080.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Clear Browser's Cookies
fields.summary: unable to create issue with issue collector

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_Anonymous made transition_ is shown on +transition+ tab, instead of the user name.
 The issue is occurring only for users that have had their username changed.

+Transition+ tab is provided by [Suite Utilities for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities/cloud/overview] add-on.


h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Change a user's username
 # Transition an issue with the user you renamed in step 1


h3. Expected Results

The name of the user who transitioned the issue should be shown


h3. Actual Results

The tab transition shows "Anonymous" instead of the user name


h3. Workaround

Name the user back to the original username or alternatively check the 'history' tab for the name of the person that executed the transition.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud - Renamed users transitioning an issue causes transition tab to show 'Anonymous' users

fields.summary: selecting type for new issue (in issues list)

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add a custom field to the create issue screen and make it required.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA has its timezone set to Caracas it is creating issues with a 30m offset because JIRA is currently using Caracas as UTC-0430, however since 2016-05-01 Caracas timezone has changed to be UTC-0400. This is detailed on this OpenJDK bug: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8151876
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA timezone to Caracas
# Create an issue

h3. Expected Results
On the issue details its time should be the same time as your computer.
h3. Actual Results
The issue appears to be created 30m ago if you hover your mouse over the "_Just Now_" text in the "_Created_" field.
 
h3. Notes
JIRA Cloud is using Java 8u77 and this fix was only backported to Java 8u101

h3.Workaround
You can set JIRA timezone to another UTC-0400 timezone instead of using Caracas' which is listed as UTC-0430
fields.summary: Issues are created with 30m difference when Caracas timezone is selected

h3. Summary
When a customer using a screen reader (such as JAWS, iOS/MacOS VoiceOver, or NVDA), the reader is no longer able to read items from the page.

h3. Environment
JIRA 1000.98.4 (not listed yet in Affects Version/s, not able to submit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn on VoiceOver utility on MacOS or iOS (or if you have one installed, use that). Adjust the settings to your liking.
# Navigate to a JIRA issue, select some text on the page, and have VoiceOver read it.
# Click *Edit*, make a change on the page, submit it.
# Now try to select text again, and you'll find it is not able to read the item.
# Click refresh, and you will be able to read from the page again.

h3. Expected Results
Screen readers should always be able to read text on the page.

h3. Actual Results
Screen reader cannot read once edit button has been submitted
 
h3. Notes
Potentially a duplicate of JRA-60491 but with extended results. This is more specific to POST-editing and not during the process.

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page to be able to read once an edit is submitted.
fields.summary: After editing an issue, screen readers are no longer able to read text from the page

fields.description:
To set an entity property, you need an instance of "SetPropertyValidationResult", which you can get by calling:
{code:java}
EntityPropertyService#validateSetProperty(user, entityId, entityPropertyInput, entityPropertyOptions)
{code}

With "skipPermissionChecks" set to *true* on the "entityPropertyOptions" parameter.
When you then call "setProperty", there is no parameter for entityPropertyOptions (and "skipPermissionChecks" flag isn't in the "SetPropertyValidationResult").
The code sets the property successfully, but then the return fails, because it tries to call "getProperty" at the end, which fails permission checking.

Discovered on JIRA version 1000.5.0, but I suspect this may affect earlier versions.
fields.summary: EntityPropertyService#setProperty does not respect skipPermissionChecks flag

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using JAWS or NVDA, input elements with role="combobox" are described only as:
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable blank' for one with nothing pre-selected
or
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable selected <Whatever is selected>'

Input elements with role="combobox" have a different id than the previous label for element.

A concrete example is <label for="project"></label>
The actual active element is <input id="project-field"></input> whereas the element labeled as "project" is a hidden input element.

This means that combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link, Sprint, and many more are indistinguishable from each other when read aloud:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link and Sprint using JAWS or NVDA

h3. Expected Results

These should be distinguishable from each other when read aloud.
h3. Actual Results

They're indistinguishable.
h3. Notes (suggested solutions)
 * change the label for id so it matches the id for the actual input element that has role="combobox"
 * swap the labels for the the style="display: none;" hidden input element with the element that has role="combobox", so the combobox one gets id "project" and the hidden input element gets the "project-field" id instead.
 * Explicitly assign an aria-label attribute for each of the combobox elements, so for the project label, combobox would have aria-label="project".

 

The JIRA combobox (single/multi select) components for things like project/issue type/priority fields don't have a correctly associated *label*. The fields start off with id="project" but after JS runs they end up with id="project-field". This was historically because it needed to avoid duplicate IDs with the original <select> field used to instantiate the component. This element no longer exists (was removed from the dom in a recent release) but the ID is still wrong.

Can solve this by using JS to change the label's *for* attribute to be "project-field".
fields.summary: Select widget labels not accessible to screen readers in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If an issue is created in JIRA and the Original Estimate Value is manually set to 0 (Zero) when time is logged, the Work Ratio value shows a large value

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-014 
* JIRA Agile v7.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
_presuming your Scrum Board is configured for Time Tracking and Original Estimate_
# Create a new issue and manually set the *Original Estimate* value to 0 (ex: 0m, 0h, 0d, etc)
# Log work on the issue by using the More > Log Work
# On the Issue Navigator Screen, add the "Work Ratio" Column or export to CSV all Fields

h3. Expected Results
Work Ratio does not show an incorrect value or shows Blank like an issue created with an Empty/Blank Original Estimate

h3. Actual Results
Created 3 Issues:
- 9 has No Estimate (Original Estimate Field left Blank on creation)
- 10 has a 0m Original Estimate on Creation
- 11 has a 15m Original Estimate on Creation
Logged 15 minutes of work on all 3 issues, below screenshot is the results:
!0MinuteEstimate.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
It appears that JIRA is trying to prevent 'dividing by 0' as the Work Ratio is calculated on Time Spent / Original Estimate 

h3.Workaround
Edit the Issue and Set the Original Estimate to the same value as Time Spent
!UpdatedOriginal.png|thumbnail!
OR
Edit the Issue clear the Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate fields
!0MinuteEstimateCleared.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Work Ratio Shows Large Number if Original Estimate was Set to 0

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When doing a JIRA Cloud import at {{/secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa}} the JIRA Import Wizard:
# fails to import a JIRA Cloud export
# is not clear on additional steps that have to be performed if the export is from JIRA Cloud
# can use a rewording for easy reading and differentiating Important Notes, Steps and Prerequisites.

This Bug request is to correct the Wording on the JIRA Import Wizard to address all types of JIRA imports and prevent Cloud import failures in case it keeps not accepting direct Cloud exports as Suggested in: [JRA-59604|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59604]

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export JIRA Cloud with Attachments
# Upload file to webdav
#  Go to *JIRA Import* section
# read carefully the notes
# Click next
# Select a JIRA Cloud export 
# Import

*Expected Result:*
JIRA Imports correctly with attachments as it is the same server export.

*Actual Results:*
Import fails
Sometimes due to Attachment problems [JRA-42738|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42738], or Memory problems.
It never imports attachments.

h3. Notes
The Import Wizard has a list of Prerequisites that are not clear enough for an administrator to follow the correct steps and avoid problems:
{quote}
*Prerequisites*
# An export of your existing JIRA instance.
# Optionally, compressed copies of:
<JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory. The contents should either have the attachments directory as the top level directory, or the project keys within the attachments directory as the top level directories.
<JIRA_HOME>/data/avatars directory. The contents should have the avatars directory as the top level directory.
<JIRA_HOME>/logos directory. The contents should have the logos directory as the top level directory.
# Please note that your JIRA instance will not have any issues attachments, user avatars or project logos if they are not restored along with your exported JIRA data.
{quote}
# The export is Cloud JIRA export
# The #2 step is optional.
#  The #3 is a Note and not a Prerequisite and it's wrong because Attachments +can+ be imported afterwards using the same importer.

It also doesn't mention that the user base in common with Confluence will be wiped out.
It also has a link to missing documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+Issues

h3.Workaround
Follow [How to restore a JIRA Cloud application backup into another JIRA Cloud application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+restore+a+JIRA+Cloud+application+backup+into+another+JIRA+Cloud+application]
fields.summary: JIRA Import Wizard is not clear on the format needed to import a Cloud Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Replies or forwards via email are getting into JIRA as comments of the original email instead of new tickets even though there is no issue-key on the subject.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.610.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a "Create a new issue or add comment to an exiting issue" mail handler set
# Send an email to that mail handler
#* JIRA will create a new ticket (e.g.: AB-1)
# Reply or forward that same email to the mail handler

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should create a new ticket since there's no issue-key on the subject of the email

h3. Actual Results
JIRA is adding a comment to the first ticket it created (AB-1)
 
h3. Notes
Our [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-779288896.html] documentation states that:
{quote}This handler creates a new issue or adds a comment to an existing issue. *If the subject contains an issue key*, the message is added as a comment to that issue. +If no issue key is found, a new issue is created in the default project.+{quote}

h3.Workaround
If a new ticket needs to be created, do not use forward or reply. Copy the email content and send a new one.
fields.summary: "create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue" mail handler not working

fields.summary: Unable to create/edit incoming mail handlers of type "Cloud Mail Handler"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A webhook isn't sent when you have it filtered with a JQL "_status Changed TO <some status>_"
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud version 1000.526.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook
# On the 'Issue Related Events' filter it with the JQL "_status changed TO <some status>_" (on my testing I was changing it form "To Do" to "In Progress")
# Check the '_Issue updated_' event
# Go to an issue and transition it to the status set in the JQL above

h3. Expected Results
JIRA would fire a webhook to the informed URL (this could also be verified on the JIRA log by adding the "com.atlassian.webhooks" class as debug)
h3. Actual Results
No webhook is fired when the issue is transitioned

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Webhook doesn't fire on "Changed TO" JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bulk edit issues doesn't redirects to the bulk edit wizard from System Saved Filters

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a System Saved filter (Example *My open Issues*)
# Click Bulk edit those issues

h3. Expected Results
The Bulk operation wizard is shown 

h3. Actual Results
The link redirects to the first filter in the list
 
h3. Notes
For *Saved Filters* by users it works as expected. 

h3.Workaround
Enter the query used by the filter in the search field
fields.summary: Bulk edit issues doesn't redirects to the bulk edit wizard from System Saved Filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA backup hangs when using IE11
h3. Environment
 * IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a JIRA instance using IE11
 # Go to backup manager and click on Create Backup

Expected Results

A .zip file should be generated and displayed on the page
h3. Actual Results

Creating backup keeps spinning as if the .ZIP file wasn't ready yet but, it's possible 
to see in jlog that backup process was completed. 
Also, when you access the Backup Manager page using another browser it's possible to see that the .zip file 
was created and is available for download.
The below exception is thrown in the browser logs:

SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'includes' File: com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.ondemand-backup-manager-jira:resources.js, Line: 104, Column: 8

 

Notes

Tested the same process with Mozilla and Chrome, with this browser creating backup worked fine.
Tried to refresh Create Backup page in IE11 without success.
h3. Workaround

Create backup using Mozilla or Chrome. Or if the backup was already created using IE11 you can simply access the Backup Manager page using a modern browser like Firefox, Chrome or Edge and the link will be displayed there.
fields.summary: JIRA backup hangs when using IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA quick search cursor is scrambling around in Firefox due to Time Reports gadget. It only happen when you open Dashboard that has Time Reports gadget.

h3. How to replicate
# Open JIRA in Firefox
# Create a Dashboard
# Add Time Reports gadget to your Dashboard -> Save.
# Click on JIRA Quick search at the right corner of the page
# Type something to search, wait for a second and the cursor will be back to the beginning

h3. Workaround
- Use another browser like chrome, etc.
- Or you can remove Time Reports gadget from the Dashboard
fields.summary: JIRA quick search cursor is scrambling around in Firefox due to Time Reports gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to save Bubble Chart gadget configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a dashboard and add _Bubble Chart_ gadget
# Select any existing filter/project
# Save

h3. Expected Result

The configuration setting is saved and the gadget displays the data.

h3. Actual Result

The gadget doesn't show the data and clicking _Save_ does nothing. Refreshing the page, below error is shown:
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Getting _400_ error in Network Console:
{noformat}
PUT https://<instance URL>/rest/dashboards/1.0/10700/gadget/14200/prefs 400 (Bad Request)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to save Bubble Chart gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The HipChat integration popup is showing the following message for administrator users in instances where there's no HipChat integration at all:
 !HCPopup.png|thumbnail! 
Disabling the add-ons (HipChat for JIRA, Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core, Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin) doesn't help for the popup to disappear.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login in a JIRA Cloud instance using an administrative account.

 
h3. Notes
If you dismiss the popup it won't appear again.

h3.Workaround
Not available
fields.summary: HipChat integration is out of date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a sub-task is converted to an issue, it cannot be converted back into a sub-task. The option _Convert to sub-task_ does not appear in the *more* drop down menu of the issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce 

# Create a sub-task.
# Convert it to an issue ( i.e Task, story, improvement) by clicking (...) -> *Convert to Issue*.
# Convert it back to sub-task by clicking (...) -> *Convert to Sub-task*.

h3. Actual Result

*Convert to Sub-task* option is missing.

h3. Expected Result

*Convert to sub-task* option should be shown.

fields.description:
The Mail handler contains logic to ensure it does not create issues that exceed a specified size. This is in order to defend against out of memory errors when viewing an issue, however it still loads the email content into memory before making such checks.

If the mail is large enough JIRA will run out of memory and the email will not get handled, and the process will repeat the next time the mail fetcher runs.

A stacktrace showing the problem in flight is given below:
{noformat}
 Stacks at the moment of snapshot capture Threads shown: 1 of 118


 Caesium-1-3 tid=131 [RUNNABLE] [DAEMON] <--- OutOfMemoryError happened in this thread
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError.<init>() OutOfMemoryError.java:48
java.lang.StringBuilder.append(String) StringBuilder.java:136
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.recordFromAddressForAnon(ApplicationUser, Message, String) CreateIssueHandler.java:489
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.getDescription(ApplicationUser, Message) CreateIssueHandler.java:470
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.handleMessage(Message, MessageHandlerContext) CreateIssueHandler.java:215
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(Message, MessageHandlerContext) CreateOrCommentHandler.java:133
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$1.process(Message, MessageHandlerContext) MailFetcherService.java:381
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$MessageProviderImpl.getAndProcessMail(MailFetcherService$MessageProvider$SingleMessageProcessor, MailServer, MessageHandlerContext) MailFetcherService.java:260
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.runImpl(MessageHandlerContext) MailFetcherService.java:371
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingService.run() AbstractMessageHandlingService.java:229
com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run() JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61
com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runService(JiraServiceContainer) ServiceRunner.java:62
com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runServiceId(Long) ServiceRunner.java:44
com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runJob(JobRunnerRequest) ServiceRunner.java:32
com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob() JobLauncher.java:153
com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse() JobLauncher.java:118
com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch() JobLauncher.java:97
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(RunMode, Date, JobDetails) CaesiumSchedulerService.java:453
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(QueuedJob) CaesiumSchedulerService.java:447
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(QueuedJob) CaesiumSchedulerService.java:394
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(QueuedJob) CaesiumSchedulerService.java:279
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(Object) CaesiumSchedulerService.java:275
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(QueuedJob) SchedulerQueueWorker.java:78
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob() SchedulerQueueWorker.java:70
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run() SchedulerQueueWorker.java:40
java.lang.Thread.run() Thread.java:745
{noformat}

There's a couple of things we could better here - we render the message body to a string, and then we use naive string concatenation to add to it. We should check the size of the message before reading it all, and use a buffer to hold the content until we're done manipulating it.
fields.summary: Mail handler should set a max size on the email it handles

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JSW projects, adding the *{{jira.permission.edit.denied}}* or the *{{jira.permission.edit.user=<user>}}* property to a step in the workflow disallows you from editing that issue but does not stop your from modifying issues associated with it. For example, an Epic issue that has a workflow that blocks editing for other users does not stop them from moving stories out of the Epic.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.383.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project (Project1)
 # Create an Epic in the Project (Epic 1)
 # Create an issue (Story1)
 # Assign Story1 to Epic1
 # Go to Workflow administration: https://<instance>/secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa
 # Click add workflow (Epic workflow)
 # Add status 'In Progress' and make sure we can get to this Status by setting all status' are able to transition into this
 # Click In progress
 # Click Properties
 # Add property: key: jira.permission.edit.user value: <username>, e.g. jashmore
 # Go to Project1 - Project Settings - Workflows
 # Add workflow (Epic workflow)
 # Assign this workflow to the Epic Issue type
 # Go back to the backlog
 # Transition Epic1 to In Progress
 # See that we cannot not add issues to Epic1.
 # Try to move issues out of the Epic, which is allowed

h3. Expected Behavior

The story should not be able to be removed from the Epic
h3. Actual Behavior

JIRA allows the issue to be removed from the Epic.
h3. Workaround

None so far
fields.summary: jira.permission.edit.denied still allows user to remove issue from epic

fields.description:
h3. It's no longer possible to attach screenshots directly from the clipboard

h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.73.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a screenshot - Print Screen on Windows or Command + Ctrl + shift + 3 on MacOS
# Open an issue
# Press Ctrl + V (Command + V on MacOS)

h3. Expected Results

The screenshot is attached to the issue

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Notes

Affects all browsers

h3.Workaround
* As a temporary workaround, you can click on "More > Attach Files" . Then you will be able to paste the screenshot. OR;
* Click on the *Edit* button of a ticket, scroll right down to access the Description or Comments field (if enabled) and you can paste screenshots as usual. This would avoid needing to update the _Description/Comments_ in a separate step.


----

h3. Update
An update is currently being rolled out to customers within their [maintenance windows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Maintenance+windows].  Thanks again for your patience while we ensured a suitable fix.
fields.summary: Unable to attach screenshots from clipboard.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The column button is not working in Tempo Timesheets in latest JIRA Cloud. 
The issue is in all views where the "column" button is (User, Project, etc.) using the "list" format


h3. Environment
The issue only happens in version 1000.25.1
The button is working fine in version 1000.5.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA (having the proper rights) select *Tempo* > *Timesheets* 
# On the top right of the page select: *User Timesheet*
# In the drop-down list below select "list" (by default "timesheets" is selected). See that the view is changing and that the *Column* button appears 
# Click on the *Column* button

*Alternative:*
# In JIRA (having the proper rights) select *Tempo* > *Accounts*  and choose an account
# On the top right of the page select *Time Tracking*
# In the dropdown button that appears below, select *List*. See that the view is changing and that the *Column* button appears 
# Click on the *Column* button


h3. Expected Results
A dropdown menu with some options is displayed:
!02-column-button-does-work.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and nothing is logged (neither in JIRA logs, nor in the Developer console):
!01-column-button-doesnt-work.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
- Works fine in version 1000.5.2
- The add-on provided a bug ticket open for this issue:
https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-3183


h3.Workaround
From [TT-3183|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-3183]:
{quote}
As a workaround, you can export the Timesheet to Excel and pivot the table to show the data that is relevant for you (http://blog.tempo.io/2012/pivoting-tempo-and-jira-reports-using-excel/)
{quote}
fields.summary: Column button not working in Tempo Timesheets in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users with Administrators role in JIRA Project will not be able to see *Project settings* module without having JIRA Administrators permission from Global Permissions in JIRA.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user and give them Administrators role in a test project. Ensure not to assign this user to groups that would put them in the JIRA Administrators permission according to current Global Permissions.

h3. Expected Results
- Administrators of a project should be able to administer said projects' settings.

h3. Actual Results
# Login as your test user, you will see that the *Project settings* module is missing:
!image2.png|thumbnail!
# If you add the user to one of the groups listed for JIRA Administrators in Global Permissions, they will be able to see the option again.

h3.Workaround
# Click on the project from the JIRA Administration menu on the top right.
# The list of projects that the user has the permission to will be displayed. 
!image.png|thumbnail!
# Click on project and you'll be redirected to the Project Administration page.

Optional 2nd workaround: Can provide the accounts with JIRA administrators permission.
fields.summary: Project Settings are hidden for the user with project administration permission without the JIRA Administration Global Permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a comment to an issue that you don't have permission to comment on the project, it does not say that you don't have permission, it shows a communications breakdown warning.
On the Issue View screen there is no option to add a comment, which is correct due to permissions.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.253.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board or the ticket
# Select an issue
# Add a comment to an issue where you don't have permission to do it.

h3. Expected Results
A warning must appear saying you don't have permission for it or the comment section shouldn't be available.

h3. Actual Results
Communication Breakdown warning.
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-16 at 5.13.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Solution
If comments should be permitted, add the required permissions in the Project Permissions Scheme
If comments should not be permitted, disregard the message.
fields.summary: Communications Breakdown when commenting on Issue without permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you change the username of an user on the user management screen, when you try to use the user on any JQL query on the issue navigator, you will not be able to select basic search, it will appear greyed out, the only option is advanced search.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-010 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# First of all, create a user and then change the username of this user
# Open your JIRA Cloud instance, at the top open the "Search" menu and click on "search for issues"
# On the advanced search build a query that uses the username of the user that changed the username
# An example: "assignee = [username]"
# Try to use the basic search, the button is greyed.

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to change to basic search

h3. Actual Results

Basic search is restricted only for users that did not changed username
 
h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
The user must use the advanced search.

You can see the screenshot attached for more details.
fields.summary: Not possible to use basic search with users that changed username

fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadget Fails to Populate Data when Using Custom field as Statistic Type
JIRA, Confluence and Bamboo Cloud Unavailable for European Customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to edit Avatar within their JIRA User Profiles page /secure/ViewProfile.jspa
 
h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud - v1000.319.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA
# Click profile picture menu at the top right of JIRA
# Select Profile option - https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
# Click on existing Avatar

h3. Expected Results
Brings up a pop up to upload a new image for avatar

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

*Note:* Also the top menus are broken as they don't display anything when clicking on them.

h3.Workaround
If JIRA Service Desk is enabled, use the Profile section of the Service Desk portal to modify the Avatar: /servicedesk/customer/user/profile
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Avatar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The transition either fails with error or the transition buttons are completely gone from issue view.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v1000.98.0
* JIRA Suite Utilities add-on in use

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue 
# Try to close it (or transition it to another status)

h3. Expected Results
Transition buttons are displayed / Issue is transitioned

h3. Actual Results
The transition either fails with an error or the transition buttons are completely gone from issue view.

an error can be seen in the logs such as (accessible in cloud by Atlassian staff only)
{noformat}
com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround

For cloud customers, log a request in the cloud project at https://support.atlassian.com and the Atlassian Support team will be able to resolve the issue. 
No downtime for JIRA is required.
fields.summary: JIRA unable to transition issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some issues that are on a business board are not found when the user tries to open the issue view.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Business project
 # Add more than 1000 issues to this project. (For example 1500)
 # Go to the business board. The first 1000 issues were added to the board (according to the limit of 1000 issues per board)
 # Click to open the issue with id 1, for example

h3. Expected Results

It should open the all issues filter and show the details of the issue with id 1
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't find the issue with id 1 and opens the last issue created.
  
h3. Notes

It was possible to see that the All issue filter used in the board is limited in the amount of issues. As this filter is ordered by Created Desc, it doesn't find issues that are older, even though they're still in the board.

h3. Workaround

Enable "Board issue details" JIRA Core Labs feature:
# navigate to "JIRA Administration" > "Applications" > "JIRA Core Labs"
# enable "Board issue details" to preview the issue details in the board directly.

Edit the issue ID directly in the URL
 # Once the page loads and redirect you to the last issue created, you'll see that the URL is something like this {{[https://xxxx.atlassian.net/projects/xxx/issues/ID-999?filter=allissues]}}.
 # Edit the URL by changing the issue ID and deleting {{?filter=allissues}}, it should look like this after editing {{[https://xxxx.atlassian.net/projects/xxx/issues/ID-1]}}. Click on enter after editing in order to load the page.
fields.summary: Business board filter only list the first 1000 issues ordered by created date

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.482.3

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a project
# Select *Reports* on the left side pane and select *Version Workload Report*
# Proceed with report generation with any parameter

h3. Workaround
When you receive the HTTP 500 Error, modify the URL for the report and remove the section *&subtaskInclusion=onlySelected*

fields.description:
When trying to close an issue, a select group of our users is experiencing and issue where they try to close/resolve an issue but the loading spinner never goes away an the issue is never closed. Other users are not experiencing this issue. 

This is thrown each time they attempt to close the issue:
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'getEffectiveIssueId' of undefined
{noformat}

These users are also experiencing similar problems commenting on issues where they submit a comment but the page never updates with the comment they just posted. It only appears when they refresh the page. 

Let me know if more information is required.
fields.summary: TypeError: Cannot read property 'getEffectiveIssueId' of undefined

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, if a user sets the post-function 'Set Field Value from Parent' to the creation transition, creates a parent, and then creates a sub-task, the sub-task will not inherit the field value of the parent issue. It does not matter which value this is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the 'Set Field Value from Parent' post-function to any field for the create transition.
# Create a task and set it to any user
# Create a sub-task for the parent
# The field that should populate with the value from the parent will remain either empty, or what it is by default.

h3. Expected Results
Field should populate with value in the parent issue.

h3. Actual Results
Field remains what it initially is.
 
h3.Workaround
None, other than to set the field manually in the sub-task.
fields.summary: Workflow Post-Function 'Set Field Value from Parent' Not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Doing a second JIRA Import right after another import fails with a Out Of Memory Error.
On the stage "Starting the JIRA Plugin System"

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a brand new JIRA Cloud site
# Create 1 project, 1 issue
# Export JIRA with or without attachments
# Re-zip contents following [How to restore a JIRA Cloud application backup into another JIRA Cloud application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+restore+a+JIRA+Cloud+application+backup+into+another+JIRA+Cloud+application] or just use the previous export if it was not done with attachments.
# do "JIRA Import" using the backup.zip and attachments.zip packed on previous step
# Wait for JIRA to finish importing
# Do again a "JIRA Import" using the same files

h3. Expected Results
Backup is imported again with no errors

h3. Actual Results
JIRA runs out of memory and import fails to complete. First the timeout "Page unavailable" is shown and then:
 !nopreviousimport.jpeg|thumbnail! 

This appears in the logs:
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to Preview a document attachment uploaded to an issue with the most recent release of Firefox, the document preview starts the loading process, but the document never loads. (Tested with PDF, Word, and Excel documents)

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.0-OD-04-029
* Firefox 45.0 and 45.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a PDF attachment to any JIRA issue.
# Click on the attachment thumbnail to open the preview feature

h3. Expected Results
Preview feature loads successfully to navigate through the document.

h3. Actual Results
The preview feature begins the loading process but continues loading indefinitely without bringing up the attachment. The following are observed in the browser console logs:

h3. Notes
The preview feature functions properly on latest versions of Chrome, IE, and Safari, and older versions of Firefox. The preview feature also functions properly when previewing images. This is also an issue with the current version of Confluence, as linked on this case.
fields.summary: JIRA - Unable to Preview Document Attachments in Latest Firefox Version

fields.description:
When you first sign in to JIRA 7.1.0-OD-05 and get taken to the main onboarding flow the top left 'hotdog' navigation menu is missing:

 !screenshot-1.png!  

This bug was not present in 7.1.0-OD-04, where the hotdog menu is clearly visible:

 !image-2016-01-22-13-23-59-469.png!
fields.summary: Navigation hotdog menu missing during onboarding

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New [JIRA Business Project Templates|https://blogs.atlassian.com/2017/03/jira-admins-5-new-business-templates-to-make-onboarding-easier/] have been added into Cloud Instances however, Admins are unable to create new projects with them

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a JIRA Cloud Instance, try to create one of the new Projects from Template
# Projects (menu) > Create Project
# Click on "More Project Templates"
# Select one of the new Templates (Content Management, Recruitment, Document Approval, Lead Tracking, or Procurement)
# Populate the Project Name, Key, Project Lead and click Submit 

h3. Expected Results
New Project is created based on the selected Template

h3. Actual Results
Error message on screen indicating: 
{quote}Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.{quote}
!CreateFromTemplate.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the JIRA Log file:
{noformat}
2017-03-08 22:00:13.221660500 2017-03-08 22:00:13,216 http-nio-3004-exec-20 ERROR scranford 1320x3598x1  4.15.43.214 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.core.hook.LeadTrackingProjectCreateHook': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 2 of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory]: No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}
2017-03-08 22:00:13.221683500 org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.core.hook.LeadTrackingProjectCreateHook': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 2 of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory]: No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No qualifying bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.util.I18nHelper$BeanFactory] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {}
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Similar error for each Template, the 'CreateHook' changes based on the Template's Name

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Unable to Create New Business Projects

fields.description:
On April 26, a new enhancement was released.

{quote}Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink.{quote}

This is causing major readability problems on our issue tickets. The extra information is getting in the way of reading comments. See attached screenshots.

As a Jira Cloud user, we don't have a way of turning off this unwanted feature.
fields.summary: Links to other JIRA issues enhancement released 26 APR 2016 causing readability problems

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the date time format in Look and Feel to include the timezone, the Issue View shows incorrect timezone format.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Navigate to {{Look and Feel}}
# Change the *Complete Date/Time Format* appending {{a z}} at the end (e.g: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a z)

h3. Expected Result

The Created and Updated time/date format should be displayed as {{27/Feb/16 9:29 AM MYT}} in both Issue View Screen and Issue Navigator view

h3. Actual Result

The date/time format is not rendered properly in Issue View Screen:
!Selection_132.png|thumbnail!

But it is displaying fine when viewing from the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Date time does not render the correct timezone format in Issue View Screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

{{Portal-only}} users can be mentioned using (@), added as Watchers and set as Reporter in {{Software}} projects.
h3. Environment

Reproduced in both versions below:
 * JIRA v1000.552.3 - PROD
 * JIRA v1000.456.2 - DEV

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with {{restricted portal access}}
 # Create a {{Software}} project.
 # Create a issue using any type of {{Issue Type}}
 # Try mention the user and add it as watcher.

h3. Expected Results
 - {{Portal-only}} users should {{not}} appear on the picker list when using mentions and watcher options. They are appearing as follow the screenshots below:

h3. Watcher:

  !Watcher.png|thumbnail!
h3. Mention:

  !Mention.png|thumbnail!
h3. Project created:

  !Software project.png|thumbnail!
h3. User tested:

  !User.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

{{Portal-only}} users can be mentioned in {{Software}} projects.
h3. Notes

It does not make sense mention and add {{Portal-only}} users as a watcher in a Software because they do not have access to it.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Portal-only users can be mentioned using (@), added as Watchers and set as Reporter in Software projects.

fields.description: When replying to an issue in JIRA copying and pasting the permalink to comment isn't working in Chrome (Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)). In Firefox it works fine.
fields.summary: Permalink to comment is not working in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking the Comment Link button or navigating to a JIRA Comment Permalink in Chrome does not Jump the Browser Window to the Comment

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-04
** Chrome (Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit))
** Safari (version 9.0.3 (11601.4.4))

Originally reported in:
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-05-006
** Chrome 47.0.2526.111 (64-bit) and 48.0.2564.82 (64-bit)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# When viewing a JIRA Issue Comment, click the Comment Link Icon
or 
# Click a URL to a Permalinked JIRA Issue Comment
or
# Right Click > Copy & Paste JIRA Comment Permalink into the Address bar

h3. Expected Results
Page loads issue and jumps to the Permalinked comment

h3. Actual Results
Page refreshes to the top of the JIRA Issue.  If you scroll down into the comments, the linked comment is highlighted 
If the comment is contained within the Collapsed Comments section, the page does not load to the comment. 
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Firefox (version 44.0.2 and 45.0.1) appears to work
fields.summary: Permalinks to JIRA Comments Do Not Jump to Comment in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Bad tokenization while applying JQL suggestion in unfinished statement
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JQL search
# Write incomplete query: "project ="
# Place cursor after letter 'p'
# Select any suggestion from the list

h3. Expected Results
suggestion changes the whole word, i.e. "priority ="

h3. Actual Results
suggestion changes only letter 'p': "priorityarent   =  "
 
h3. Notes
Also reproducible on following queries:
* "project = "Customer Ops"  AND "
* "project = "Customer Ops"  AND assignee "

Because of the same reason WORKS, while it shouldn't the following query:
* "project = "Customer Ops" and assAND reporter = currentUser() " -> "project = "Customer Ops" and assigneeAND reporter = currentUser() "

Works OK if query is complete: "project = "Customer Ops"", "project = "Customer Ops"  AND assignee = admin"
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud - Bad tokenization while applying JQL suggestion in unfinished statement

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using API command to [find users|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsers], max results does not work.

*maxResults*
the maximum number of users to return (defaults to 50). The maximum allowed value is 1000. If you specify a value that is higher than this number, your search results will be truncated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the following command on REST API:

{code:java}
curl -u <user>:<password> https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/search?username=%&maxResults=1000{code}

h3. Expected Results

Get more than 50 users.
h3. Actual Results

It gets only 50 users. Trying to use startAt or maxResults does not make any difference. Still get the same 50 users.
fields.summary: REST API does not get more than 50 users /rest/api/2/user/search?username=%&maxResults=1000

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unsure of the cause at this stage, and it seems to be intermittent (i.e. performing the exact same import again seems to just work).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a JIRA Cloud Import

h3. Expected Results

Import succeeds

h3. Actual Results

On occasion imports fail with the error:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.UserNotFoundException: User <foo> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.removeUserFromGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:794)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.removeUserFromGroup(DelegatingCrowdService.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.removeUserFromGroup(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:340)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.ensureNoOtherUsersAreSiteAdmin(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:371)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.doStudioImportTasks(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:325)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.importJiraExportData(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:185)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.importDataAndFiles(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.call(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.call(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to bulk transition issues within the JIRA Issue Navigator, the Transition Issues operation displays a message that reads: NOTE: You do not have permission to perform a bulk transition on the selected X issues

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud 1000.285.1
JIRA Server Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project or use an existing project that does not have a transition from Done to any other status
# Create several issues or select several issues that are in a Done status in the JIRA Issue Navigator
# Select the Bulk change option from the ... menu in the upper right hand corner
# Select all of the issues to bulk edit on the Choose Issues page
# Click Next

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should display an error message stating that there is no transition currently available to transition these issues from their current state

h3. Actual Results
JIRA displays an message stating: NOTE: You do not have permission to perform a bulk transition on the selected X issues
 
h3.Workaround
Administrators should add at least one transition from the Done status in order to remove this message
fields.summary: Permissions error is displayed when transitioning issues that have no transition available from their current workflow status

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as an admin
2. gg -> Resolutions -> Translate Resolutions.

Actual Result:
Wrong item "Issue Types" highlighted in the sidebar

Expected Result:
The Resolution item is highlighted
fields.summary: "Translate resolutions" page marks incorrect item in the admin menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Incoming emails are not creating tickets anymore. 

The mail handlers are returning: MailConnectException: Couldn't connect to host, port



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Administration > System > Incoming Mail*
# Test the connection to the mail server and see that this is successful
# Edit (or create) an incoming mail handler for the same mail server
# Click *Next*. Then at the next screen click on the test button

h3. Expected Results
The connection is successful

h3. Actual Results
The test fails and when you click to get more details you can see that below error is returned:
{noformat}
com.sun.mail.util.MailConnectException: Couldn't connect to host, port: *********, 993; timeout 10000; Using SOCKS host, port: socks, **** while connecting to host '**********' as user 'xxxxx@xxxx' via protocol 'imaps, caused by: java.net.SocketException: socks 
{noformat}
 


h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: Mail handlers throw MailConnectException

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using advanced search issues, when generate any JQL for a fix version, the "Basic" is automatically disabled saying that the this query is too complex, which is not so complex.

JIRA Version: v1000.844.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the issue navigator and switch to Advanced mode.
 # View any Release for a Project (FixVersion = XXX)
 # Try to click on "Basic"

 # Use the issue navigator and switch to Advanced mode.
 # View any Release for a Project
 # Generated JQL - "project = XXX AND fixVersion = XXX ORDER BY priority DESC, key ASC"
 # Try to click on "Basic"

h3. Expected Results

Be able to change to Basic search fix versions.
Be able to search fixVersion in Basic search.
h3. Actual Results

It is only possible to get the results using Advanced search.
fields.summary: Issue Search: Filtering by fixVersion disabled Basic search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to add a field to an issue using the "Add field" link from the issue navigator, a new modal window opens and displays the following message:
{quote}
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{quote}

This started yesterday and can still be reproduced today in our system.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an Issue, and view the issue in Issue Detail View
# Select the Admin dropdown, and select Add Field
# The error message will appear

h3. Expected Results
This should bring up the Add Field dialogue

h3. Actual Results
The error is thrown and the following errors can be seen in the browser console:
{noformat}
GET batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&hasConnectAddons=tru…:6262 https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/rest/globalconfig/1/issuecustomfields/null/fields?onAllScreensFlag=true&_=1456866446792 404 (Not Found)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
If you search for the issue using Issues > Search for Issues, and attempt this action in the Issue Navigator View and not the Issue Detail View, the Add Field action should work. Tested and verified.
fields.summary: 404 Error when adding field to issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some feature of JIRA Cloud is not functioning on Firefox such as Top Navigator Bar, view issue via Issue Navigator ('Search for issues' page) and update issues.

NOTE: It only happens to certain cloud instances, if you are unsure whether you are affected or not, please contact support

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud
 * Mozilla Firefox 47.0.1
 * Mozilla Firefox 47.0
 * Mozilla Firefox 4.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Log into JIRA via Mozilla Firefox 47.0.1
 ## Click on any Dashboard/Project/Issues buttons
 ## Go to Issue Navigator via [https://example.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=] to view the issues
 ## Update or add a comment to the ticket

h3. Expected Results
All the fuctions mentioned above should be working as expected:
 # Drop-down menu should be shown when clicking Dashboard/Project/Issues buttons
 # Issue can be viewed on Issue Navigator
 # Ticket should be updated

h3. Actual Results
 # Drop-down menu is not showing
 # Clicking on the issues, it shows:
 !Jira_8-1-2016_7-51-32 PM.jpg|thumbnail!
 # An error message is shown:
 !Jira_8-1-2016_8-03-50 PM.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This issue is reproducible on IE10

h3. Workaround
Use other browser to access JIRA for the mean time.

Please watch the ticket to get latest update about this issue.
fields.summary: Some functions are not working on Mozilla Firefox since Updating to latest Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a resolution is set by both screen and post function, it will not be captured in the issue history
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Version : 1000.499.4 (Cloud)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the Resolve issue transition post function to set the resolution
 # Configure the Resolve issue screen to have the resolution screen
 # Create an issue and resolve it, make sure to select the resolution field on the screen

h3. Expected Results

Issue history captures the resolution
h3. Actual Results

Issue history does not capture the resolution
  
h3. Note
* JSD notification will not be sent: [JSD-4038|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4038]

h3. Workaround

Use either one method to set the resolution and avoid using both
fields.summary: Resolution is not captured in issue history if it is set by both post function and screen

fields.description:
h2.Summary
When changing instance language to Deutsch from profile, not all system filters are translated.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Go to profile.
# Change language to Deutsch.
# Go to the Issue Navigator.

h2.Expected Results
All system filters should be in Deutsch

h2.Current Results
Some system filters in Deutsch and some is in English

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: System Filters are not fully translated in Deutsch

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This could be due to a large amount of worklog entries or comments etc. 

This issue should look at how we can work with fields that can have an unbounded number of columns. This could be not allowing the export of worklog for example or thinking of an improvement to the way it is implemented to not cause this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get an instance with a large number of worklog entries/comments and issues
# Go to search issues and do a search that will return a large number of issues with a lot of worklog entries. e.g. jql=
# Click the export button
# Click Export All Fields (CSV)

h3. Expected Results
A CSV file should be produced. 

h3. Actual Results
An OOME exception is thrown. 

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
No workaround to get a csv file but can still export using the original HTML format.
fields.summary: OOME Exception for CSV Export on large searches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Appending value by using Update Issue Custom Field post-function will replace the current value instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new *Text Field (single line)* custom field
# Go to workflow and edit any transition (e.g In Progress -> In Review) 
# Add *Update Issue Custom Field* post-functions to the transition:
#* *The Number of the issue will be set to 123.*
#* *The value 1 will be appended to field Number, or set if it is a multi field.*  (tick *append*)
#*   !workflows.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish workflow
# Create a new issue
# Transition the issue from *In Progress* to *In Review*

h3. Actual Result
The current value will be replaced instead of appended (updated value: 1):
 !issuehistory.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
The current value is appended with the value set in the second post-function (appended value: 1231)
fields.summary: Update Issue Custom Field post-function does not append value as expected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If your computer has a low resolution (let's say 1024x768) or the browser isn't maximized to the point where you see the "More" menu at the top bar, the menus within the "More" menu don't display their options when the mouse is hover over them (specially "Boards" from Agile and "Tests" from Zephyr)
h3. Environment
Tested on Windows using Firefox, IE and Chrome (doesn't work), and also tested on Mac OS X 10.11 using Firefox, Chrome and Safari (works).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the browser and restore down its window size to half screen
# Load JIRA
# You'll notice the "More" button
# Click the "More" button
# Hover the mouse over the menus

h3. Expected Results
Their sub-menus should open
h3. Actual Results
The sub-menus don't open
 
h3.Workaround
If possible increase display resolution and/or maximize the browser's window
fields.summary: Unable to select option in top bar menus when they're within "More"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Identified a problem with using Issue Statistics gadget with Tempo Account custom field as the Statistic Type. The gadget won't be populated and an error gets thrown instead:
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-05 at 2.36.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.610.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Tempo account and link it to a project.
# Select an issue
# Set the Issue Statistics gadget up and selected the Account as Statistics Type for the gadget. 

The following is found in logs:
{code}2016-12-02 22:32:14.015561500 2016-12-02 22:32:14,011 http-nio-2991-exec-20 ERROR <user> 1352x313300x1  103.233.242.8 /rest/gadget/1.0/stats/generate [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Unique SelectableField not found for id 'customfield_10713'.
2016-12-02 22:32:14.015562500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unique SelectableField not found for id 'customfield_10713'.{code}

h3. Expected Results
Gadget should be populated

h3. Actual Results
Gadget is not populated and an error is thrown
 
h3.Workaround
It has been verified that this issue only occurs on {{v1000.610.1}}. The same doesn't happen on {{v1000.610.2}}.
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget with Tempo Account custom field
SQL code block is not displaying correctly

fields.description:
h2.Summary

Issue collector throws an error when attachments are attached to IE 11. This has been successfully being replicated on 11.0.9600.17631 . 

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Load an issue collector on IE 11.
# Try to raise a new ticket and attach a new file to the ticket.
# The below error will be returned {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.}} .
# Attempting the action again will return {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.}}.

h2.Expected results.
Attachments should be attached to the ticket without issues.

h2.Current results
Attachment cannot be attached and error message is returned.

Note : Issue collector worked fine on my latest version of Chrome (Version 51.0.2704.103 m) .
fields.summary: Issue Collector returns error when attachments are being attached on IE

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to edit an issue is not possible as it displays the following errors:
* If they're the assignee: User cannot be assigned issues.
* If they're the reporter: The reporter specified is not a user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user test user {{eg:aaa}}.
# Create an issue and assign that user to it, and make them the reporter.
# Deactivate that user.
# Edit the issue via *Edit Issue* screen.
# Update.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is able to be saved.

h3. Actual Results

When saving the issue, the errors in the attached screenshot are presented and the issue cannot be saved.
* Assignee field: User cannot be assigned issues.
* Reporter field: The reporter specified is not a user.

h3. Workaround
Remove *Reporter* field or *Assignee* field from *Edit Issue* screen

h3. Notes

# This validation is not applied when using Inline Edit
# Custom field (user picker) does not affected
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Issue When Reporter/Assignee is Deactivated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to set the _Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed_ in JIRA's General Configuration as this option vanished.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA with Administrators global permission
# Click the Cog menu and select _System_
# Click the _Edit Settings_ button in the _General Configuration_ tab

h3. Expected Results
The _Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed_ option should be there below the _Application title_ at the top.
h3. Actual Results
The option isn't there.
 
h3. Notes
Tested on JIRA Cloud version 7.1.0-OD-02-025 (hash bf893f01c57338b8e5e432ca7c509242a7bd2393)
Downgraded my test instance to 7.0.0-OD-08-005 (hash d0a599825401a37b9558840bc01618f8634cf00c)

Typing g+g then "captcha" shows the suggestion, but after selecting it the option isn't there.
fields.summary: CAPTCHA option is missing form General Configuration

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results
Description is no longer displayed

No workaround at the moment
